MICHAEL MULL, THE CSUN JAZZ "A"

2716.52.text:

NATIONAL ANTHEM.

2718.27.text:
GOOD EVENING, EVERYONE. 
AS PRESIDENT OF THIS UNIVERSITY,

2721.42.text:
IT IS MY DISTINCT HONOR TO 
WELCOME YOU TO THE 2017

2727.21.text:
CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY 
NORTHRIDGE COMMENCEMENT CEREMONY

2731.25.text:
FOR THE 2016 AND 2017 GRADUATES
 OF THE COLLEGE OF SOCIAL AND

2737.48.text:
BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES. 
ON BEHALF OF OUR FACULTY AND

2743.39.text:
STAFF, I CONGRATULATE THE 
GRADUATES BEING HONORED HERE

2746.23.text:
TODAY. 
AS I STOOD ON THE STEPS OF THE

2749.45.text:
OVIATT JUST ONE YEAR AGO, IT 
SEEMS AS IF WE LIVED IN A

2756.09.text:
DIFFERENT WORLD. 
AND WHILE THE LANDSCAPE ACROSS

2759.07.text:
THE COUNTRY HAS SHIFTED, EACH OF
 YOU HERE TONIGHT, OUR

2763.86.text:
GRADUATES, HAVE DEMONSTRATED 
GREAT PERSEVERANCE TO ACHIEVE

2766.67.text:
YOUR GOALS. 
BY PERSEVERING, YOU HAVE SEEN

2769.02.text:
WHAT YOU ARE CAPABLE OF, BUT IT 
IS ONLY THE BEGINNING.

2775.74.text:
ABILITY TO PERSEVERE AND THE 
SELF-CONFIDENCE IT FOSTERS WILL

2780.07.text:
HELP YOU ACHIEVE YOUR DREAMS AND
 MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE WORLD.

2785.13.text:
ISSUES OF IMPORTANCE TO YOU, USE
 THE SKILLS YOU HAVE LEARNED

2788.43.text:
HERE AT CSUN, WHETHER THOSE 
SKILLS ARE IN CREATIVE THINKING,

2791.85.text:
CRITICAL THINKING, CREATIVITY, 
PROBLEM SOLVING, OR EMPATHY AND

2801.68.text:
RESPECTING EACH OTHER'S 
PERSPECTIVES AND ADVOCATE FOR

2807.24.text:
SOCIAL JUSTICE. 
AND REMEMBER, YOU GRADUATE WITH

2810.10.text:
THE ADVANTAGE OF A CSUN 
EDUCATION.

2813.64.text:
EVERY YEAR WE HONOR 
DISTINGUISHED ALUMNI WITH AN

2818.86.text:
AWARD, AND THIS PAST MONTH WE 
DID THE SAME THING.

2822.18.text:
AND THE EXAMPLES OF THOSE WHO 
HAVE COME BEFORE YOU AND WHAT

2826.73.text:
THEY HAVE ACHIEVED AND 
ACCOMPLISHED IS TRULY

2830.72.text:
MIND-BLOWING. 
AND I HOPE THAT AS YOU SEE AND

2832.87.text:
READ ABOUT WHAT MANY OF OUR 
ALUMS, INCLUDING SOON-TO-BE DR.

2841.56.text:
WILLIAM WATKINS, VICE PRESIDENT,
 YOU'LL HEAR FROM THIS EVENING,

2843.30.text:
YOU'LL SEE THE MANY PATHS AND 
DOORS OF OPPORTUNITY AVAILABLE

2846.67.text:
TO YOU WITH A CSUN EDUCATION. 
YOU HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE AND

2853.66.text:
ABILITY TO SUCCEED. 
SOME OF YOU MAY CHOOSE TO FOREGO

2858.40.text:
COMPLETELY TRADITIONAL 
DISCIPLINE AND DECIDE TO FORGE

2860.95.text:
NEW PATHS, NEW DISCIPLINES, AND 
AREAS THAT WE DON'T EVEN KNOW

2865.61.text:
EXIST YET. 
AND YOU WILL BE THOSE PIONEERS.

2870.88.text:
CSUN GRADUATES TOUCH EVERY 
SECTOR, EVERY INDUSTRY, EVERY

2874.86.text:
FIELD, AND HAVE MADE A 
SIGNIFICANT MARK ON THE WORLD.

2878.81.text:
AND EACH OF YOU HAS THE 
POTENTIAL TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE.

2883.22.text:
BUT REGARDLESS OF YOUR PATH, AS 
YOU MOVE TO NEW OPPORTUNITIES,

2889.04.text:
PLEASE PROMOTE INCLUSIVITY IN 
YOUR COMMUNITIES AS YOU DID AT

2899.76.text:
VALUE AND RESPECT DIVERSITY AND
 THE COMMON HUMANITY SHARED BY

2903.96.text:
US ALL. 
PROTECT OUR ENVIRONMENT AND OUR

2911.75.text:
DISCOVERY. 
CONTINUE TO USE THE KNOWLEDGE

2914.63.text:
GAINED HERE TO SUPPORT TOLERANCE
 AND STRIVE TO UNDERSTAND

2920.54.text:
OTHERS' VIEWS. 
OUR SHARED FUTURE DEPENDS ON IT.

2928.36.text:
EQUIPPED YOU WELL FOR THESE 
TASKS.

2931.59.text:
ALLOW ME TO THANK OUR FACULTY 
AND STAFF WHO ARE HERE TODAY TO

2934.31.text:
SHARE IN THE PRIDE OF YOUR 
ACHIEVEMENTS.

2938.10.text:
CSUN'S FACULTY AND STAFF HAVE 
PLAYED A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN

2947.47.text:
IN AND OUT OF THE CLASSROOM IN 
THEIR EFFORTS TO ADVANCE STUDENT

2950.29.text:
EXCELLENCE, OUR UNDERSTANDING 
OF THE WORLD THROUGH

2952.86.text:
GROUNDBREAKING RESEARCH, AND THE
 UNIVERSITY'S MISSION MAKE THEM

2955.67.text:
THE HEART OF THIS UNIVERSITY. 
THANK YOU TO OUR FACULTY AND

2959.32.text:
STAFF WHO ARE HERE TODAY. 
[ APPLAUSE ]

2967.03.text:
MUCH OF YOUR EXPERIENCE AT CSUN 
WAS SHAPED BY THE GENEROSITY OF

2971.60.text:
THOSE WHO CAME BEFORE YOU, BUT 
ALUMNI WHO HAVE SUPPORTED

2976.92.text:
SCHOLARSHIPS, ENHANCED PROGRAMS,
 AND IMPROVED THE FACILITIES YOU

2979.52.text:
LEARNED IN EACH DAY.

2984.26.text:
TO SEE THAT MORE THAN 6,000 OF 
OUR GRADUATING STUDENTS

2989.73.text:
CONTRIBUTED TO THE SENIOR CLASS 
GIFT, AND WE THANK YOU FOR THAT.

2996.37.text:
UNIVERSITY. 
AND FINALLY, I WANT TO

2999.80.text:
ACKNOWLEDGE THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF
 YOUR FAMILIES, YOUR FRIENDS,

3002.21.text:
MANY OF WHOM ARE HERE TODAY TO

TO THE PARENTS, BROTHERS,

3011.88.text:

3020.75.text:
CSUN.

3022.22.text:
AS PART OF THE CSUN FAMILY.

3028.54.text:
SUCCEEDED WITHOUT YOUR GUIDANCE,
 YOUR LOVE, YOUR ENCOURAGEMENT,

AND SOMETIMES YOUR SACRIFICE.

THANK YOU, DR. HARRISON.

IT IS MY GREAT PLEASURE TO

3230.21.text:
EXTRAORDINARY STUDENTS WHO

3233.14.text:
STUDENTS, PLEASE RISE WHEN I

BROOK IS A POLITICAL SCIENCE 
MAJOR WHO HAS EARNED A GPA OF

3252.39.text:
3.90 HERE AT CSUN.

3256.01.text:
COURSES, BROOK HAS BEEN ACTIVE

INCLUDING SERVING AS HEAD

3266.67.text:
UNITED NATIONS PROGRAM AND

3271.41.text:
UNIVERSITY IN SOUTH KOREA.

3275.74.text:
A HAROLD SCHULWEIS SOCIAL

3280.96.text:
WATCH, AN ORGANIZATION THAT

3285.71.text:
ATROCITIES AROUND THE WORLD BY

WHILE AT JEWISH WORLD WATCH,

3301.65.text:

3311.61.text:

OFF CAMPUS TO RAISE AWARENESS 
OF MASS ATROCIIES COMMITTED

3320.84.text:
WORLDWIDE, INCLUDING THE WALK TO
 END GENOCIDE IN SANTA ROSA.

NOT SURPRISINGLY, BROOK IS A 
MEMBER OF THREE HONORS

3329.22.text:
SOCIETIES, INCLUDING THE ORDER 
OF OMEGA, A GREEK LEADERSHIP

3333.74.text:
HONOR SOCIETY RECOGNIZING THE

3338.92.text:
INVOLVED IN GREEK LIFE ON

 SOCIETY, AND GAMMA SIGMA ALPHA,

3352.63.text:
NATIONAL GREEK HONOR SOCIETY.

3363.77.text:
TEACHING ENGLISH IN MOROCCO 
BEFORE PURSUING A GRADUATE

3365.65.text:
DEGREE IN INTERNATIONAL 
DEVELOPMENT EITHER IN THE UNITED

3367.33.text:
STATES OR ABROAD. 
HER ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO BECOME A

3370.19.text:
FOREIGN SERVICE OFFICER FOR THE
 U.S. STATE DEPARTMENT, WHILE

3373.07.text:
SIMULTANEOUSLY WORKING TO 
EMPOWER WOMEN AND GIRLS IN

3384.80.text:
OUR SECOND EXTRAORDINARY STUDENT
 TONIGHT IS COURTNEY DYER.

3390.82.text:
BORN AND RAISED IN VENTURA, 
CALIFORNIA, COURTNEY KNEW SHE

3395.61.text:
WAS GOING TO MAJOR IN HISTORY IN
 COLLEGE AFTER TAKING AN

3400.63.text:
ADVANCED PLACEMENT COURSE DURING
 HIGH SCHOOL, WHERE SHE

3404.69.text:
REALIZED, AS SHE SAYS, "HISTORY 
IS LIKE A GIANT STORY THAT IS

3408.15.text:
WAITING FOR SOMEONE TO TELL IT, 
AND I WANTED TO ADD MY VOICE TO

3411.03.text:
THOSE WHO TOLD IT."  
SINCE ENTERING CSUN, COURTNEY

3415.63.text:
HAS MADE THE DEAN'S LIST EVERY 
SEMESTER AND IS GRADUATING TODAY

3423.66.text:
A 3.90 GPA. 
COURTNEY IS A WELL-ROUNDED

3426.80.text:
STUDENT WHOSE EXTRAORDINARY 
ACADEMIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS ARE

3430.47.text:
BALANCED WITH AN EQUALLY 
IMPRESSIVE LIST OF COCURRICULAR

3438.10.text:
COURTNEY CONQUERED HER FEAR OF 
PUBLIC SPEAKING AND HELPED

3441.71.text:
COUNTLESS HIGH SCHOOLERS MAKE 
THE DECISION TO CHOOSE CSUN

3443.74.text:
THROUGH HER FUNNY BUT 
INFORMATIVE CAMPUS TOURS.

3447.72.text:
OFF CAMPUS, SHE VOLUNTEERED AT 
THE MUSEUM OF TOLERANCE AND THE

3456.88.text:
SHE ALSO COMPLETED A STUDY 
ABROAD PROGRAM IN POLAND AND

3460.46.text:
LITHUANIA, WHERE SHE EXPLORED 
THE IMPACT OF COMMUNISM AND THE

3468.52.text:
COURTNEY RECENTLY COMPLETED A 
COMPETITIVE INTERNSHIP AT A

3471.73.text:
LEGAL AGENCY PROVIDING FREE 
LEGAL ASSISTANCE FOR LOW-INCOME

3474.57.text:
RESIDENTS OF LOS ANGELES. 
THERE SHE NOT ONLY FELL IN LOVE

3479.38.text:
WITH THE COURTROOM ENVIRONMENT 
BUT ALSO APPRECIATED THE

3481.70.text:
OPPORTUNITY TO UTILIZE HER 
EXPERTISE AS A HISTORY MAJOR.

3485.26.text:
COURTNEY HAS RECENTLY BEEN 
ACCEPTED INTO SEVERAL

3488.64.text:
PRESTIGIOUS LAW SCHOOLS. 
SHE WILL CONTINUE HER EDUCATION

3492.47.text:
WITH FUNDING AT PEPPERDINE 
UNIVERSITY LAW SCHOOL THIS FALL.

3500.34.text:
AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION. 
PLEASE JOIN ME IN CONGRATULATING

3520.23.text:
WITH A DEGREE IN POLITICAL 
SCIENCE WITH AN EMPHASIS IN LAW

3522.71.text:
AND SOCIETY. 
SHE HAS BEEN AN OUTSTANDING

3524.84.text:
STUDENT, HAVING EARNED A GPA OF 
3.93.

3527.84.text:
IN ADDITION TO HER SUCCESSFUL 
ACADEMIC WORK HERE ON CAMPUS,

3541.86.text:
2015 CSUN PANETTA CONGRESSIONAL 
INTERNSHIP, A HIGHLY SELECTIVE

3542.13.text:
INTERNSHIP PROGRAM IN WASHINGTON
 D.C. IN WHICH ONE STUDENT FROM

3544.83.text:
EACH CSU CAMPUS IS SELECTED.

3549.63.text:
INSPECT CAPITOL HILL OFFICE OF 
REPRESENTATIVE GRACE NAPOLITANO.

3557.62.text:
LOS ANGELES COUNTY ARTS 
COMMISSION EASTER THEATER GROUP

3560.50.text:
DURING SUMMER OF 2016. 
AND SHE IS THE RECIPIENT OF THE

3570.05.text:
SCIENCE'S 2016 JUDITH AND 
GERALD ROSENBERG AWARD FOR

3573.28.text:
SCHOLARLY ACHIEVEMENT. 
THIS PAST YEAR ANGELINA HAS BEEN

3576.23.text:
SUPPORTING STUDENT SUCCESS 
ACROSS CAMPUS AS THE STUDENT

3578.54.text:
ASSISTANT FOR THE OFFICE OF 
STUDENT SUCCESS

3583.44.text:
INNOVATIONS. 
ANGELINA HAS ALSO ENGAGED IN

3587.24.text:
EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY WORK, 
INCLUDING VOLUNTEERING AS A

3589.61.text:
STUDENT COACH FOR MONROE HIGH 
SCHOOL'S SPEECH AND DEBATE TEAM,

3593.48.text:
SERVING AS A TEACHING ASSISTANT
 FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH SPECIAL

3596.68.text:
NEEDS AT BOTH THE MILLER CAREER 
AND TRANSITION CENTER AND AT NEW

3604.10.text:
HORIZONS. 
SHE ALSO WORKS AT THE SAN

3610.26.text:
FERNANDO VALLEY COMMUNITY 
COORDINATOR FOR THE TONGAN

3615.75.text:
ALLIANCE ASSOCIATES. 
FINALLY, AT THIS YEAR'S HONORS

3619.20.text:
CONVOCATION, ANGELINA WAS NAMED 
THE 2017 WOLFSON SCHOLAR.

3623.81.text:
THIS IS THE TOP ACADEMIC AWARD 
PRESENTED TO A MEMBER OF THE

3627.81.text:
UNDERGRADUATE CLASS AT CSUN. 
ANGELINA WILL NO DOUBT CONTINUE

3631.30.text:
TO EXCEL IN HER FUTURE 
ENDEAVORS, AND IN PREPARING NOW

3650.56.text:
ANGELINA!
THE TRUSTEES OF THE CALIFORNIA

3651.82.text:
STATE UNIVERSITY HAVE THE 
PRIVILEGE TO AWARD HONORARY

3655.11.text:
DOCTORATES TO PERSONS DEEMED TO 
HAVE MADE EXTRAORDINARY

3658.90.text:
CONTRIBUTIONS TO SOCIETY. 
THIS YEAR CSUN RECOGNIZES A

3662.94.text:
PERSON WORTHY OF THIS HONOR. 
THE NOMINATION WAS APPROVED BY

3667.94.text:
OUR BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND IT IS 
A GREAT HONOR FOR US TO PRESENT

3673.06.text:
THIS DEGREE AT THIS CEREMONY. 
MR. MICHAEL WATANABE, PLEASE

3677.12.text:
COME TO THE PODIUM AND BE 
RECOGNIZED FOR YOUR MANY

3681.90.text:
ACHIEVEMENTS. 
MR. WATANABE'S CITATION WILL BE

3684.85.text:
READ BY STEPHEN STEPANEK, WHO 
SERVES AS THE TRUSTEE OF THE CSU

3691.89.text:
AND WHO WILL JOIN ME IN THE 
FORMAL

3701.14.text:
HOODING. 
THANK YOU, AS A MEMBER OF THE

3704.31.text:
BOARD OF TRUSTEES, I HAD THE 
PLEASURE TO SUPPORT THE

3706.10.text:
NOMINATION OF MR. WATANABE FOR 
THIS HONORARY DEGREE.

3708.99.text:
THE DEGREE CITATION NOTES THAT 
MICHAEL N. WATANABE, PRESIDENT

3713.71.text:
AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF 
THE ASIAN-AMERICAN DRUG ABUSE

3718.44.text:
PROGRAM, WHOSE INSPIRATIONAL AND
 CARING LEADERSHIP AND

3721.48.text:
COMMITMENT HAS CHANGED COUNTLESS
 LIVES AND SAVED FAMILIES

3726.80.text:
LOCALLY, NATIONALLY AND 
INTERNATIONALLY EXEMPLIFIES THE

3731.79.text:
UNIVERSITY'S ASPIRATIONS FOR ITS
 DIVERSE STUDENT BODY.

3734.38.text:
IN ADDITION TO HIS IMMENSELY 
SUCCESSFUL CAREER AT AADAP, HE

3738.50.text:
HAS SERVED WITH DISTINCTION IN 
NUMEROUS COMMUNITY-BASED

3742.55.text:
ORGANIZATIONS AND IS A HIGHLY 
RESPECTED ROLE MODEL BOTH HERE

3747.37.text:
AND ABROAD. 
AN ALUMNUS OF CSUN, MR. WATANABE

3751.20.text:
SERVED TWO AND A HALF YEARS IN 
THE UNITED STATES ARMY WITH A

3754.25.text:
TOUR IN VIETNAM BEFORE RETURNING
 TO THE U.S. AND COMPLETING HIS

3759.72.text:
UNDERGRADUATE STUDIES IN 1973.
WHILE PURSUING HIS MASTER'S WORK

3764.06.text:
IN SOCIAL WORK, SHE WAS 
INTRODUCED TO THE WORK OF AADAP,

3785.78.text:
AFTER JOINING AADAP IN 1975, MR.
 WATANABE HAS SERVED THERE FOR

3789.27.text:
ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO 
SERVING ASIANS, PACIFIC

3791.29.text:
42 YEARS, AND HAS BEEN PRESIDENT
 AND CEO FOR THE PAST 34 YEARS.

3795.59.text:
UNDER HIS LEADERSHIP AADAP HAS 
GROWN INTO A LARGE,

3799.74.text:
COMPREHENSIVE SERVICE AGENCY 
SERVING A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF

3801.93.text:
THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY THROUGH 
TEN SERVICE SITES, HIS SUCCESS

3804.27.text:
AT AADAP HAS EARNED RECOGNITION 
AND COMMENDATIONS FROM COMMUNITY

3810.45.text:
LEADERS AND PUBLIC OFFICIALS. 
HIS RECORD OF SERVICE ALSO

3813.43.text:
INCLUDES IMPORTANT LEADERSHIP 
ROLES ON A VARIETY OF COMMUNITY

3815.40.text:
AGENCIES OVER THE YEARS. 
IT IS NOW MY PLEASURE TO ASK

3823.26.text:
PRESIDENT HARRISON TO COME 
FORWARD TO CONFER THE HONORARY

3824.65.text:
DEGREE. 
IN RECOGNITION OF HIS REMARKABLE

3826.94.text:
PROFESSIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AND 
HIS EXTENSIVE LEADERSHIP AND

3829.31.text:
SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY, THE 
BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE

3830.96.text:
CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY AND 
CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY,

3834.67.text:
NORTHRIDGE ARE VERY PROUD TO 
CONFER UPON MICHAEL N.

3840.88.text:
WATANABE THE HONORARY DEGREE OF 
DOCTOR OF HUMANE

3893.46.text:
CONGRATULATIONS. 
IT IS A BIG DAY FOR YOU.

3899.81.text:
IT IS A PRETTY BIG DAY FOR ME 
TOO.

3903.59.text:
I CAN'T FULLY EXPRESS HOW DEEPLY
 HONORED I AM TO ACCEPT THIS

3909.65.text:
HONORARY DEGREE. 
I WANT TO THANK PRESIDENT DIANNE

3914.08.text:
HARRISON, THE CSUN ACADEMIC 
SENATE, AND THE SELECTION

3918.94.text:
COMMITTEE. 
YOUR AFFIRMATION OF THE WORK

3921.35.text:
THAT I HAVE DONE AT AADAP IS 
DEEPLY APPRECIATED.

3925.01.text:
I WOULD LIKE TO THANK CHANCELLOR
 TRINITY WHITE AND THE CSU BOARD

3927.45.text:
LETTERS. 
AND WILL PRESENT HIS BRIEF

3929.92.text:
OF TRUSTEES FOR THE ENDORSEMENT
 OF THIS VERY SPECIAL DEGREE.

3937.66.text:
THANK YOU. 
I ALSO WANT TO THANK MY OLD

3943.62.text:
FRIEND, DR. HERMAN DUBOIS, PAST 
CHAIRMAN OF THE SOCIOLOGY

3949.44.text:
DEPARTMENT, WHO RECOMMENDED ME. 
STAND UP, HERMAN.

3959.17.text:
MADE ME DO THAT. 
THE HONORARY DOCTORATE WOULDN'T

3964.51.text:
BE POSSIBLE WITHOUT THE PEOPLE 
AT AADAP, PAST AND PRESENT.

3968.16.text:
I WANT TO THANK THE MANY CURRENT
 AND FORMER BOARD MEMBERS, THE

3972.98.text:
MANAGERS, AS WELL AS LONGTIME 
FRIENDS WHO SHARE A STRONG

3976.78.text:
COMMITMENT TO SOCIAL JUSTICE AND
 SUPPORT OF AADAP.

3981.70.text:
WILL YOU ALL PLEASE STAND AND 
ACCEPT YOUR APPLAUSE, AADAP

3989.41.text:
FAMILY?
I ESPECIALLY WANT TO THANK TWO

3996.44.text:
FOUNDERS, CARL NOBOJUKI, WHO 
WROTE THE PROPOSAL FOR AADAP AND

4004.71.text:
DR. FUKUMOTO, WHO ADVOCATED FOR
 IT IN WASHINGTON.

4009.13.text:
PLEASE STAND AND BE RECOGNIZED. 
CSUN PLAYED A VERY SPECIAL ROLE

4013.09.text:
IN MY LIFE. 
IT WAS HERE THAT THE ROOTS OF MY

4017.94.text:
CAREER WERE FORMED. 
I FIRST CAME HERE DURING THE

4021.76.text:
CIVIL RIGHTS MOVEMENT AND THE 
PROTEST OF THE VIETNAM WAR IN

4025.36.text:
THE 1960s. 
THAT GENERATION WAS ENGAGED IN A

4029.47.text:
GREAT STRUGGLE FOR SOCIAL 
JUSTICE, BOTH HERE AND ABROAD.

4032.94.text:
THE FIGHT FOR CIVIL RIGHTS, THE 
ACTIONS AGAINST POVERTY, THE

4038.64.text:
PUSH FOR ETHNIC STUDIES, 
RESISTANCE TO THE WAR ALL

4043.65.text:
CONSUMED THAT GENERATION. 
IT TOOK A TOLL ON MANY OF US IN

4049.83.text:
DRUG ABUSE, OVERDOSES, VIOLENCE 
IN THE STREETS, AND THE SHOCKING

4054.66.text:
ASSASSINATIONS THAT CAME IN 
THAT DECADE.

4059.06.text:
PRESIDENT KENNEDY, MALCOLM X., 
MARTIN LUTHER KING, AND FINALLY

4068.98.text:
ROBERT KENNEDY HIT HARDEST AND 
CLOSEST TO HOME.

4072.77.text:
HE SPOKE ON THIS CAMPUS THE 
AFTERNOON OF HIS ASSASSINATION.

4077.09.text:
HE SHOOK MY HAND AS HE WALKED 
THROUGH THE CROWD ON HIS WAY TO

4081.51.text:
THE AMBASSADOR HOTEL, WHERE HE 
WAS KILLED.

4087.35.text: BY THAT FALL, I COULDN'T RETURN.

4091.74.text:
I DROPPED OUT, WAS DRAFTED, AND 
WENT TO VIETNAM.

4097.79.text:
AFTER MY DISCHARGE, I CAME BACK 
TO CSUN TO PICK UP

4103.29.text:
WHERE I HAD LEFT OFF. 
IT WAS HERE THAT I WAS

4106.98.text:
INTRODUCED TO THE WORLD OF 
PROFESSIONAL SOCIAL WORK.

4111.59.text:
IT WAS AN PIPHANY FOR ME. 
PROFESSIONAL SOCIAL WORK OFFERED

4115.45.text:
ME THE FRAMEWORK TO CHANNEL THE
 PASSION THAT I HAD FELT FOR

4118.42.text:
YEARS OF SOCIAL AND POLITICAL 
RAGE.

4123.00.text:
CSUN GAVE ME THAT STRUCTURE. 
THE SOCIOLOGY DEPARTMENT WAS

4126.98.text:
DEVELOPING THE MSW PROGRAM AT 
THE TIME.

4128.88.text:
THE NEW FIELD OF DRUG ABUSE WAS 
JUST BEING CREATED.

4136.77.text:
CSUN WAS AT THE VANGUARD ON THAT
 BEGINNING.

4140.84.text:
IN A RARE OPPORTUNITY AT THIS 
UNDERGRADUATE LEVEL, I WAS

4146.83.text:
PLACED ON A COUNTY PANEL THAT 
REVIEWED FUNDING FOR PROPOSALS

4150.62.text:
FOR DRUG ABUSE SERVICES. 
IT GAVE ME AN EXPERIENCE OF HOW

4157.62.text:
SOCIAL POLICY CAN DRIVE SOCIAL 
JUSTICE.

4160.31.text:
FACULTY GUIDED ME TO GRADUATE 
SCHOOL AND BY THE TIME I

4164.17.text:
GRADUATED CSUN, MY COURSE WAS 
PRETTY WELL SET TO GO TO

4167.86.text:
GRADUATE SCHOOL, WORK IN DRUG 
ABUSE, AND WORK IN THE

4172.78.text:
ASIAN-AMERICAN COMMUNITY. 
AFTER GRADUATE SCHOOL, I FOUND

4177.27.text:
AADAP. 
IT WAS A PERFECT PLACE FOR ME.

4179.59.text:
I STARTED THERE IN 1975. 
OVER THE

4187.06.text:
FOUR DECADES, AADAP HAS GROWN 
AND CHANGED THOUSANDS OF LIVES

4193.52.text:
AND SAVED THEIR FAMILIES. 
HUNDREDS OF LEADERS HAVE BEEN

4197.25.text:
TRAINED TO PURSUE SOCIAL JUSTICE
 THROUGH THEIR WORK ON AADAP.

4201.37.text:
WE ENGAGED IN PUBLIC POLICY AND 
ADVOCATED ON BEHALF OF CLIENTS

4203.75.text:
AND FAMILIES, WE PLACED 
THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE IN SOUTH LOS

4206.83.text:
ANGELES IN EMPLOYMENT. 
WE ENROLLED HUNDREDS IN

4210.50.text:
OBAMACARE. 
ALL OF THESE EFFORTS GUIDED BY

4212.72.text:
THE PURSUIT FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE 
THAT BEGAN

4218.36.text:
HERE AT CSUN. 
SO I'M AT THE AGE LOOKING BACK,

4221.90.text:
BUT UH, YOU ARE JUST BEGINNING 
YOUR JOURNEY.

4225.76.text:
AT THE BEGINNING OF MY JOURNEY, 
WE WERE ENGAGED IN A TREMENDOUS

4230.90.text:
STRUGGLE FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE. 
AND GUESS WHAT?

4235.58.text:
YOU ARE ON THE CUSP OF ANOTHER 
GREAT STRUGGLE.

4239.68.text:
THE PROGRESS WE HAVE MADE OVER 
THE LAST 40 YEARS IN GENERAL AND

4245.16.text:
THE LAST EIGHT YEARS IN 
PARTICULAR ARE UNDER ATTACK.

4252.48.text:
THE RIGHT TO VOTE, THE RIGHT TO 
HAVE AFFORDABLE HEALTH CARE, THE

4256.78.text:
RIGHT OF WOMEN TO CONTROL THEIR
 OWN BODIES, RIGHT OF EQUAL

4262.03.text:
PROTECTION FOR LGBTQ PEOPLE, THE
 RIGHTS OF RELIGIOUS FREEDOM,

4267.14.text:
THE RIGHTS OF IMMIGRANTS, THE 
RIGHT TO SURVIVE GLOBAL WARMING,

4274.16.text:
THE RIGHT TO ENJOY A PROTECTED 
ENVIRONMENT, THE RIGHT TO

4278.92.text:
RATIONAL DRUG POLICIES, AND THE 
RIGHTS OF THE POOR AND

4281.84.text:
MINORITIES. 
ALL OF THESE ARE UNDER ATTACK.

4287.00.text:
THE RELAUNCHING OF THE WAR ON 
DRUGS BY THE ATTORNEY GENERAL

4291.43.text:
TWO WEEKS AGO WILL TURN BACK THE
 PROGRESS WE HAVE MADE TO REDUCE

4293.80.text:
THE HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS OF 
BLACK AND LATINO PRISONERS IN

4299.32.text:
THE JAILS FOR A HEALTH PROBLEM. 
IT WILL SET BACK THE PROGRESS ON

4310.03.text:
RATIONAL MARIJUANA POLICY. 
I WAS IN GRAD SCHOOL WHEN

4313.32.text:
RICHARD NIXON WAS FORCED TO 
RESIGN FOR OBSTRUCTION OF

4318.63.text:
JUSTICE. 
ON TUESDAY, A SPECIAL COUNSEL

4321.07.text:
WAS NAMED TO INVESTIGATE THIS 
PRESIDENT IN HIS ROLE IN THE

4326.47.text:
RUSSIAN INCURSION IN OUR 
ELECTIONS AND WHETHER HE

4344.77.text:
29TH, IS THE HUNDREDTH BIRTHDAY 
OF PRESIDENT JOHN F. KENNEDY.

4346.69.text:
IN 1960 AT HIS INAUGURATION, HE 
SAID, "ASK NOT WHAT YOUR COUNTRY

4353.48.text:
CAN DO FOR YOU. 
ASK WHAT YOU CAN DO FOR YOUR

4356.61.text:
COUNTRY."  
THOSE WORDS LAUNCHED A WAVE OF

4359.01.text:
ACTIVISM IN OUR GENERATION. 
THEY PROPELLED DR. DUBOIS AND

4364.55.text:
HIS WIFE MAUREEN O'MALLEY TO 
JOIN THE PEACE CORPS AND GO TO

4373.30.text:
KENYA. 
THEY PLANTED A SEED IN MY MIND

4376.20.text:
THAT LED ME HERE TODAY. 
NEXT MONDAY YOU CAN CELEBRATE

4381.53.text:
HIS BIRTHDAY BY TAKING HIS WORDS
 TO HEART AND MAKING A

4385.93.text:
COMMITMENT TO SOCIAL JUSTICE. 
I ENCOURAGE ALL OF YOU TO FIND A

4390.28.text:
PLACE TO DO YOUR SOCIAL WORK 
WHERE YOU CAN ENGAGE IN THE MOST

4396.38.text:
PUT YOUR PASSION ON THE LINE, IN
 THE STREETS, AND DO YOUR SOCIAL

4399.44.text:
WORK. 
THE NEXT TWO YEARS, MAYBE FOUR,

4403.36.text:
MAY BE THE MOST CRITICAL TIME OF
 YOUR FUTURE AND THE FUTURE OF

4427.02.text:
THANK YOU. 
THANK YOU, DR. MIKE, FOR THOSE

4429.42.text:
INSPIRING WORDS. 
IT IS NOW MY DISTINCT PLEASURE

4432.65.text:
TO INTRODUCE DR. YI LI, OUR 
PROVOST, WHO WILL PRESENT THE

4443.24.text:
THANK YOU, PRESIDENT HARRISON.
WILL ALL CANDIDATES FOR THE

4449.64.text:
MASTER'S DEGREE PLEASE RISE?
PRESIDENT HARRISON, FROM THE

4454.61.text:
COLLEGE OF SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL
 SCIENCES, I

4459.45.text:
PRESENT THE CANDIDATES FOR 
MASTER OF ARTS IN HISTORY,

4466.66.text:
ARTS IN POLITICAL SCIENCE, 
MASTER OF ARTS IN SOCIOLOGY,

4475.00.text:
MASTER OF PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION,
 MASTER OF SCIENCE IN APPLIED

4484.72.text:
MASTER OF SOCIAL WORK. 
THESE CANDIDATES HAVE COMPLETED

4489.95.text:
THE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE 
MASTER'S DEGREE AS PRESCRIBED BY

4495.44.text:
THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA AND THE
 TRUSTEES OF THE CALIFORNIA

4497.93.text:
STATE UNIVERSITY, AND THEY HAVE 
BEEN RECOMMENDED BY THE FACULTY

4506.20.text:
CANDIDATES, PLEASE CONTINUE 
STANDING AS PRESIDENT HARRISON

4513.69.text:
MASTER'S DEGREE UPON YOU. 
UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE

4520.51.text:
FACULTY OF CALIFORNIA STATE 
UNIVERSITY, NORTHRIDGE, AND BY

4523.33.text:
THE AUTHORITY VESTED IN ME BY 
THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, I CONFER

4529.18.text:
UPON YOU THE DEGREE OF MASTER OF
 ARTS IN HISTORY, MASTER OF ARTS

4534.70.text:
IN POLITICAL SCIENCE, MASTER OF
 ART IN SOCIOLOGY, MASTER OF

4541.26.text:
PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION, MASTER OF
 SCIENCE IN APPLIED BEHAVIOR

4552.32.text:
SOCIAL WORK. 
WITH ALL OF THE RIGHTS, THE

4554.70.text:
HONORS, AND THE RESPONSIBILITIES
 PERTAINING THERETO.

4570.23.text:
BE SEATED. 
AT THIS TIME I WILL ASK DR.

4572.09.text:
STELLA THEODOULOU, THE DEAN OF 
THE COLLEGE OF SOCIAL AND

4575.03.text:
BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES, TO NOW 
PRESENT THE CANDIDATES FOR

4581.87.text:
THE BACCALAUREATE DEGREE. 
THERE ARE FIVE DISCIPLINES

4585.90.text:
REPRESENTED BY THE GRADUATES IN 
THIS CEREMONY TODAY.

4589.73.text:
THEY ARE FROM THE DEPARTMENTS OF
 AFRICANA STUDIES, HISTORY,

4610.92.text:
STUDIES AND PLANNING. 
WILL ALL THE CANDIDATES FOR THE

4615.22.text:
BACCALAUREATE DEGREE FROM THE 
COLLEGE OF SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL

4619.63.text:
SCIENCES PLEASE RISE AND REMAIN
 STANDING?

4629.09.text:
YES, IT IS YOU. 
PRESIDENT HARRISON, I HAVE THE

4630.10.text:
HONOR OF PRESENTING TO YOU THE 
UNDERGRADUATE

4640.64.text:
CLASS OF 2017. 
THESE CANDIDATES HAVE COMPLETED

4641.79.text:
THE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE 
BACCALAUREATE DEGREE AS

4645.19.text:
PRESCRIBED BY THE STATE OF 
CALIFORNIA AND THE TRUSTEES OF

4651.66.text:
AND THEY HAVE BEEN RECOMMENDED 
FOR THEIR DEGREES BY THE FACULTY

4662.52.text:
WELL, THEN. 
UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE

4668.02.text:
FACULTY OF CALIFORNIA STATE 
UNIVERSITY AND BY THE AUTHORITY

4670.14.text:
VESTED IN ME BY THE BOARD OF 
TRUSTEES, I CONFER UPON YOU THE

4673.98.text:
DEGREE OF BACHELOR OF ARTS IN 
AFRICANA STUDIES, BACHELOR OF

4681.39.text:
ARTS IN HISTORY, BACHELOR OF 
ARTS IN POLITICAL SCIENCE,

4687.13.text:
BACHELOR OF ARTS IN PUBLIC 
SECTOR MANAGEMENT, BACHELOR OF

4695.85.text:
IN SOCIOLOGY, AND THE BACHELOR 
OF ARTS IN URBAN STUDIES AND

4705.21.text:
PLANNING. 
WITH ALL OF THE RIGHTS, THE

4707.99.text:
HONORS, AND THE OPPORTUNITIES 
PERTAINING THERETO.

4716.65.text:
BE SEATED. 
MEMBERS OF THE PLATFORM PARTY

4722.50.text:
AND THE DEPARTMENT CHAIRS WILL 
NOW OFFER CONGRATULATIONS TO OUR

4725.10.text:
DEGREE RECIPIENTS. 
I ASK THAT THE DEGREE RECIPIENTS

4728.86.text:
PLEASE MOVE TO THE PLATFORM AS 
DIRECTED BY THE MARSHALS.

4732.94.text:
PLEASE COME FORWARD AS YOUR NAME
 IS READ.

4738.10.text:
YOU WILL BE CONGRATULATED BY A 
MEMBER OF THE PLATFORM PARTY AND

4740.77.text:
RECEIVE YOUR DIPLOMA COVER AND 
CERTIFICATE.

4743.23.text:
AFTERWARDS, PLEASE RETURN TO 
YOUR SEATS AS DIRECTED BY THE

4749.49.text:
I ASK THAT GUESTS PLEASE HELP SO
 THAT WE MAY PROCEED IN AN

4753.93.text:
ORDERLY MANNER. 
WE REMIND YOU THAT THE AISLES

4757.77.text:
MUST BE KEPT OPEN AND YOU ARE 
ASKED TO STAY IN YOUR SEATS

4760.38.text:
UNTIL THE END OF THE CEREMONY.
OUT OF RESPECT FOR OUR GRADUATES

4763.04.text:
AND THE SAFETY OF OUR GUESTS, 
NOISEMAKERS AND HOPEFULLY

4773.88.text:
NOT PERMITTED. 
FINALLY, AND AGAIN, OUT OF

4777.19.text:
RESPECT FOR YOUR FELLOW 
GRADUATES, ALL GRADUATES WILL

4780.44.text:
REMAIN THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE 
CEREMONY UNTIL ALL DEGREE

4820.56.text:
DEPARTMENT OF AFRICANA STUDIES.

FACULTY OF CALIFORNIA STATE 
UNIVERSITY NORTHRIDGE AND BY THE

PLANNING WITH ALL THE RIGHTS,

THE DAVID MARIJUANA COLLEGE OF

8842.60.text:
WILL ALL OF THE BACCALAUREATE 
DEGREE RECIPIENTS

8848.05.text:
PLEASE RISE?
IN ACADEMIC TRADITION, THE

8853.53.text:
STUDENT WHO HAS NOT YET EARNED A
 DEGREE WEARS THE TASSEL TO THE

8856.90.text:
RIGHT OF THE MORTARBOARD. 
WHEN THE DEGREE IS CONFERRED,

8860.35.text:
THE SCHOLAR MOVES THE TASSEL TO 
THE LEFT AND JOINS THE SELECT

8864.94.text:
COMPANY OF HIGHLY EDUCATED MEN 
AND WOMEN.

8867.07.text:
IN RECOGNITION OF YOUR NEW 
STATUS, WILL ALL RECIPIENTS OF

8869.90.text:
THE BACCALAUREATE DEGREE MOVE 
THE TASSEL TO YOUR

8881.74.text:
LEFT?
I WELCOME YOU INTO THE ALUMNI

8886.27.text:
FAMILY OF CALIFORNIA STATE 
UNIVERSITY, NORTHRIDGE.

8896.47.text: THANK YOU, AND PLEASE BE SEATED.

8903.15.text:
I KNOW. 
RONNIE GOODMAN WILL NOW

8908.32.text:
OFFICIALLY WELCOME YOU INTO THE 
CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY,

8923.59.text:
ON BEHALF OF CSUN ALUMNI 
ASSOCIATION AND MORE THAN

8929.69.text:
340,000 MATADORS, IT IS MY 
PLEASURE TO DO THE FIRST FORMAL

8935.49.text:
ACCEPTANCE WELCOMING YOU INTO 
THE ALUMNI OF OUR GREAT

8943.98.text:
NOW, EACH ONE OF YOU MAY ADD THE
 TITLE "ALUMNUS" OR "ALUMNA" TO

8951.00.text:
YOUR NAME. 
WE ARE HONORED TO JOIN WITH YOU

8953.02.text:
TO CELEBRATE YOUR ACHIEVEMENTS. 
TODAY MARKS THE BEGINNING OF AN

8957.53.text:
WE ENCOURAGE YOU TO STAY 
CONNECTED AS YOU REALIZE YOUR

8960.25.text:
DREAMS AND YOUR ASPIRATIONS. 
IN FACT, YOU WILL FIND MANY

8966.68.text:
MATADORS OUT THERE, JUST LIKE 
ME, READY TO BE WILLING TO HELP

8969.50.text:
YOU AND REALIZE YOUR POTENTIAL 
AND YOUR FUTURE SUCCESS.

8973.00.text:
IN TURN, IN TURN, SOMEDAY WE 
HOPE THAT YOU WILL PAY BACK WITH

8979.48.text:
AID THE NEXT GENERATION THAT 
FOLLOW YOU IN YOUR PATH.

8983.61.text:
CONGRATULATIONS, AND WELCOME TO 
YOUR CSUN ALUMNI FAMILY.

8988.04.text: WE ARE ALL VERY PROUD OF YOU.

8999.83.text:
SO NOW IT IS EASY. 
GO OUT INTO THE WORLD,

9002.82.text:
ACCOMPLISH GREAT THINGS, AND 
COME BACK AND TELL US ABOUT THEM

9005.49.text:
SO WE CAN BRAG ABOUT YOU.
TO OFFICIALLY CLOSE THIS

9010.74.text:
CEREMONY, I ASK THAT ALL OF OUR 
STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND CSUN

9015.24.text:
ALUMNI AND STAFF RISE FOR THE 
UNIVERSITY ALMA MATER, HAIL TO

9019.45.text:
THE MATADORS, UNDER THE MUSICAL 
DIRECTION OF MICHAEL MULL AND

9023.23.text:
THE CSUN JAZZ "A" BAND AND SUNG 
BY KRISTE JOGA.

9026.12.text:
THE WORDS TO THE ALMA MATER ARE 
AT THE BACK OF YOUR COMMENCEMENT

9029.42.text:
PROGRAM SHOULD YOU NEED THEM. 
AFTER THE ALMA MATER, PLEASE

9033.64.text:
REMAIN AT YOUR SEATS UNTIL THE 
PLATFORM PARTY AND FACULTY HAVE

9038.70.text:
RECESSED. 
WE PLEASE ASK THAT ALL PARENTS

9041.10.text:
AND GUESTS REMAIN SEATED UNTIL 
THE END OF THE RECESSIONAL.

9044.57.text:
AGAIN, THANK YOU ALL VERY MUCH. 
CONGRATULATIONS TO OUR

9050.22.text:
GRADUATES. 
AND ONCE A MATADOR, ALWAYS

9067.39.text:
♪ ALL HAIL TO ALL THE MATADORS 
AND TO OUR SCHOOL SO DEAR ♪ AS

9077.64.text:
WE MOVE ALONG THE ROAD OF LIFE,
 LET US KEEP FROM DOUBT OR FEAR

9087.38.text:
♪ FOR THE KNOWLEDGE WHICH WE 
FIND HERE, FOR ALL WHO URGE US

9098.94.text:
THE RED AND WHITE WILL BRIGHTEN
 EVERY DAWN ♪

9109.12.text:
WHERE THE SUN IS SHINING AND 
WHERE TRUTH LEAVES AN OPEN DOOR

9120.10.text:
STRONG AND COURAGE TALL WE HAIL
 OUR MATADOR!
